org.ensor.algorithms.astar.grid

Class GridMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.algorithms.astar.grid.GridMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMap<GridMover,GridNode>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GridMapCompassMoves, GridMapDiagonalMoves, HexMap

    public abstract class GridMap
extends Object
implements IMap<GridMover,GridNode>
    This class is an abstract base class which provides functionality common to most 'grid' type maps. This includes a square grid, a hexagonal grid, or any grid which is similar in nature. This implements most of the IMap methods from the IMap interface in the AStar package.
    Author:
    Jon

    • Method Detail

      • addNode

        public void addNode(GridNode n)
        This method adds a particular grid node to the map. The node itself contains information about itself including the position and any bitmap flags which indicate the ability for various movers to pass the node.
        Parameters:
        n - The node to add to the map.

      • removeNode

        public void removeNode(int x,
              int y)
        This method removes the node at the specified position in the map.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the node to remove.
        y - The y coordinate of the node to remove.

      • addNode

        public void addNode(int x,
           int y,
           int passableFlags)
        This method adds a node to the map at the specified x, y coordinates. If there is a node already, this method adds the specified flags to that node to permit passage by movers with matching flags.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the node to add.
        y - The y coordinate of the node to add.
        passableFlags - The movement flags to add.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        This method returns the total width of the map.
        Returns:
        Returns the width of the map.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the map.
        Returns:
        The height of the map.

      • getNode

        public GridNode getNode(int x,
               int y)
        Returns the node in the position x,y.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the node to return.
        y - The y coordinate of the node to return.
        Returns:
        The grid node at the specified position.

      • getNeighbors

        public abstract Collection<GridNode> getNeighbors(GridMover mover,
                                GridNode node)
        This method returns a collection of neighbors of the given node which are allowed to be traversed by the given mover.
        Specified by:
        getNeighbors in interface IMap<GridMover,GridNode>
        Parameters:
        mover - The mover which will traverse the nodes.
        node - The node to begin the movement from.
        Returns:
        A collection of nodes which can be reached by the given mover starting from the given node.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(GridMover mover,
              GridNode node)
        This method returns true if the given mover is allowed to traverse the given node.
        Specified by:
        isValid in interface IMap<GridMover,GridNode>
        Parameters:
        mover - The mover to test for traversal.
        node - The node to test for traversal.
        Returns:
        True if the given mover is allowed to pass the given node.

      • getCost

        public double getCost(GridMover mover,
             GridNode startNode,
             GridNode endNode)
        This method returns the cost of traversing from the start node to the end node. The cost is essentially the distance between the two nodes.
        Specified by:
        getCost in interface IMap<GridMover,GridNode>
        Parameters:
        mover - The entity for which to calculate movement cost.
        startNode - The starting node from which to calculate movement cost.
        endNode - The ending node from which to calculate movement cost.
        Returns:
        The cost of traversing from the start to the end node by the given mover.

      • getHeuristic

        public double getHeuristic(GridMover mover,
                  GridNode startNode,
                  GridNode endNode)
        An estimate of the distance between two nodes which may (or may not) be adjacent.
        Specified by:
        getHeuristic in interface IMap<GridMover,GridNode>
        Parameters:
        mover - The mover which is moving along the path.
        startNode - The starting node to estimate the cost from.
        endNode - The ending node from which to estimate the cost.
        Returns:
        An estimate of the cost of traversing the path.
